intro: Laetia guazumifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit or golden star, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are often used in local cuisines. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and have a velvety texture. Laetia guazumifolia thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in rainforests.
